div.p: ASSUMING FOR ARGUMENT that the PRECEDING SENTENCE IS TRUE. Contrast THEREUPON.
1. The standard word introducing the apodosis of a conditional, typically logical, but sometimes also temporal, is zé 則.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／ LU JIANMING

note.p: 557. Al. Tum temporis est praesentis, tunc temporis futuri est.
557. Inter Tum et tunc. Tum temporis est futuri; tunc, praeteriti.

sense.def: then indeed; and thereupon, and then accordingly; then without delay;Then accordingly (often after a direct speech)
then, under the concrete but hypothetical historical circumstances indicated by S
logic: under such logical conditions as S, then

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

sense.def: e.g. 回也聞一以知十 "Hui, when he heard one thing, then understood ten things": and then, thereby, so as to then, as a result
then; and then; in order to

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: after the subject of the apodosis

sense.def: then, at that time specified in the preceding (often minor) sentence
then, as a rule [examples here need to be cleaned up!!!]
then one finds out, then it turns out that
and thus then (given this situation described in S2)
then, as a logical consequence of S2 [move to necessity?]
in accordance with the contextually determinate state of affairs> and then; accordingly; thereupon immediately; on that basis, thus; and so

觀國死之人"when one considers their mistakes/faults then one understands others":then under such circumstances; then indeed, then in point of fact; then as an important (often final) result; sometimes hybrid: then this
logical: then under those logical conditions [Move logical cases here.]
at that point in time [Clear examples need to be moved here.]
then (after the subject of the apodosis, like zé 則）
thus under such circumstances, then under such circumstances
at that time (almost like 於是)
that point in time (never: period of time) See 於是 THEREUPON
then it is; then this would be
after a short while; within a short time
(one set of parallel examples:) then (like 斯 "then"); then that DADAILIJI P. 190誠在其中，此見於外。
焉＝於之 at that point, first then
怒而飛 "puffs itself up/breathes heavily and then takes flight" and then (also sometimes before nominal minor sentences)
then 本立而道生"once what is basic is established, then the Way will naturally emerge"
at the point in time identified by N 中道而廢 "one gives up mid-Way"
(When/while S was happening,) then at that time
at that point in time, then
then generally, at that point generally
and so subsequently; so in the end, then in the end, and in the end; then (as things turned out)
then, pre-classical loan for 於是

THEN + SUCH> then in such a case; then such a person; then; then as for such behaviour; then this is; then this means that; then this leads to [Note that this is not claimed to be a word, just a collocation which it is useful to study.]
then [I collect here the cases where I have so far not found it plausible or easy to attribute to shì a clear anaphoric reference.]
on the basis of this then
as a reaction to this, consequently, on the grounds of this; accordingly
at that moment then > at that point
So then; this being so then
then after S2; then in that way
and then, and so, and thus
then [[GUOYU: 必有忍也，若能有濟
then, if S1 then S2; more often written 案
modal particle marking that S1 obtains when S2 obtains: then, under these conditions
則S矣：final particle after the apodosis S1 of a conditional or temporal subordinate clause S2
則民易使也"then the people are easy to deploy": modal particle which emphasises the apodosis (sometimes also of a concessive clause in 'even if) as typically general and inevitable.
則家宰之罪也“then this will be the fault of the manager of the household": then the protasis (if-clause) S is N{PRED}
emphatically marks the apodosis of a conditional construction as definitely to be acknowledged as true
marking the apodosis of a conditional sentence
marking a highly emphatic apodosis of a conditional as definitely applying
